channel.title: Last Day - NEW & UPDATE
channel.description: All NEW and UPDATE articles from the last day with enhanced metadata

item.title: NEW: Microsoft Patches Actively Exploited Zero-Day in January 2026 Patch Tuesday Update
item.description:
Headline: Microsoft Patches Actively Exploited Zero-Day in January 2026 Patch Tuesday Update

Summary:
Microsoft's first Patch Tuesday of 2026 delivered fixes for over 110 vulnerabilities, including a critical zero-day in the Windows Desktop Window Manager (CVE-2026-20805) that is being actively exploited in the wild for information disclosure. The update, which also patches eight critical flaws, addresses vulnerabilities across Windows, Office, Azure, and SharePoint. The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has added the exploited zero-day to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog, mandating urgent patching for federal agencies.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Patch Management, Vulnerability

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: Microsoft's January 2026 Patch Tuesday addresses over 110 vulnerabilities, including an actively exploited zero-day (CVE-2026-20805) in Windows Desktop Window Manager. Learn about the critical flaws and why patching is urgent.

Article Slug: microsoft-january-2026-patch-tuesday-fixes-actively-exploited-zero-day

Published Date: Thu, 15 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 15 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 15 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Central Maine Healthcare Breach Exposes Data of Over 145,000 Patients and Employees
item.description:
Headline: Central Maine Healthcare Breach Exposes Data of Over 145,000 Patients and Employees

Summary:
Central Maine Healthcare (CMH) has disclosed a major data breach affecting 145,381 patients and employees. The incident involved an unauthorized third party maintaining access to its network for over two months, from March to June 2025. The compromised data includes highly sensitive personal, medical, and financial information, such as Social Security numbers and treatment details. CMH is offering complimentary credit monitoring services to those affected and has stated it is enhancing its security monitoring to prevent future incidents.

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Cyberattack, Regulatory

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: Central Maine Healthcare (CMH) has reported a data breach impacting 145,381 people after a prolonged network intrusion exposed sensitive personal and medical information, including Social Security numbers.

Article Slug: central-maine-healthcare-discloses-data-breach-affecting-145000

Published Date: Thu, 15 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 15 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 15 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: NPM Supply Chain Attacks Evolve into Industrialized, Credential-Driven Campaigns
item.description:
Headline: NPM Supply Chain Attacks Evolve into Industrialized, Credential-Driven Campaigns

Summary:
A new analysis reveals a significant evolution in software supply chain attacks targeting the npm ecosystem. Threat actors have moved beyond simple typosquatting to industrialized campaigns focused on compromising developer accounts and CI/CD pipelines. By stealing credentials through phishing, attackers are injecting malware into legitimate, popular packages, as seen in the 'Shai-Hulud' campaign. These attacks are often 'CI-aware,' activating only within automated build environments to steal secrets and inject malicious code, posing a severe threat to the software development lifecycle.

Severity: High

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Malware, Cloud Security

Article Type: Analysis

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: Learn how npm supply chain attacks have industrialized, moving from typosquatting to credential-driven takeovers of developer accounts and CI/CD pipelines to distribute malware like Shai-Hulud.

Article Slug: industrialized-credential-driven-npm-supply-chain-attacks-on-the-rise

Published Date: Thu, 15 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 15 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 15 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Massive Unsecured Database Leaks Personal, Health, and Financial Data of 45 Million French Citizens
item.description:
Headline: Massive Unsecured Database Leaks Personal, Health, and Financial Data of 45 Million French Citizens

Summary:
Security researchers have discovered a massive, unprotected database on a cloud server containing the sensitive records of approximately 45 million French citizens. The data, which has since been secured, appears to be an aggregation from at least five separate breaches, compiled by a data broker or cybercriminal. The exposed archive included voter registration data, healthcare records, IBANs, and CRM contact information, creating comprehensive and dangerous profiles on a significant portion of the French population.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Data Breach, Regulatory, Cloud Security

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: An unsecured cloud server has led to a massive data leak exposing the sensitive personal, healthcare, and financial records of approximately 45 million French citizens. Learn about the aggregated data and the impact.

Article Slug: massive-data-leak-exposes-records-of-45-million-french-citizens

Published Date: Thu, 15 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 15 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 15 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Manufacturing Giant Ju Teng Probes Breach After Incransom Leaks Client Data from Dell, HP, BMW
item.description:
Headline: Manufacturing Giant Ju Teng Probes Breach After Incransom Leaks Client Data from Dell, HP, BMW

Summary:
Manufacturing giant Ju Teng International Holdings is investigating a data breach after the Incransom ransomware group claimed to have stolen 200GB of sensitive data and posted it for sale on the dark web. The compromised information allegedly includes confidential project details, product drawings, and financial records belonging to Ju Teng and its high-profile clients, including Dell, HP, BMW, and Mercedes-Benz. The incident underscores the significant supply chain risk posed by attacks on manufacturers with access to sensitive partner data.

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Supply Chain Attack

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: Manufacturing firm Ju Teng International investigates a major data breach after the Incransom ransomware group leaks 200GB of data allegedly belonging to clients like Dell, HP, and BMW.

Article Slug: ju-teng-international-probes-data-breach-after-client-info-leaked-on-dark-web

Published Date: Thu, 15 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 15 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 15 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Hackers Abuse Signed GitKraken Binary in DLL Side-Loading Campaign to Distribute RATs and Stealers
item.description:
Headline: Hackers Abuse Signed GitKraken Binary in DLL Side-Loading Campaign to Distribute RATs and Stealers

Summary:
A new malware campaign detailed by Trellix is leveraging a DLL side-loading vulnerability in a legitimate, signed executable ('ahost.exe') from the c-ares library, distributed with GitKraken's Desktop app. By placing a malicious 'libcares-2.dll' in the same directory, attackers trick the signed binary into loading their code, bypassing security defenses. This technique is being used to deliver a wide range of commodity malware, including Agent Tesla, Vidar Stealer, Remcos RAT, and Quasar RAT, primarily targeting industrial and commercial sectors with invoice-themed lures.

Severity: High

Categories: Malware, Threat Actor, Phishing

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: Researchers uncover a DLL side-loading campaign abusing a legitimate, signed GitKraken executable to bypass security and deploy malware like Agent Tesla, Vidar Stealer, and Remcos RAT.

Article Slug: active-campaign-uses-dll-side-loading-to-deploy-rats-and-info-stealers

Published Date: Thu, 15 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 15 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 15 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: VoidLink: New Modular Linux Malware Framework Discovered Targeting Cloud and Container Environments
item.description:
Headline: VoidLink: New Modular Linux Malware Framework Discovered Targeting Cloud and Container Environments

Summary:
Security researchers at Check Point have discovered 'VoidLink,' a highly sophisticated and modular Linux malware framework. Written in the modern Zig programming language, VoidLink is purpose-built for espionage in cloud and containerized environments. It can detect if it's running in AWS, GCP, Azure, Kubernetes, or Docker and adapt its behavior. With a plugin-based architecture inspired by Cobalt Strike, it features advanced rootkit capabilities, an in-memory plugin system, and tools for credential theft from cloud services and Git repositories. Though not yet seen in the wild, its advanced design poses a significant future threat.

Severity: High

Categories: Malware, Cloud Security, Threat Actor

Article Type: Analysis

Reading Time: 7 minutes

Meta Description: Discover VoidLink, a new, highly modular Linux malware framework written in Zig. It's purpose-built for espionage in cloud environments like AWS, GCP, and Kubernetes, with advanced stealth and credential theft capabilities.

Article Slug: voidlink-new-modular-linux-malware-targets-cloud-environments

Published Date: Thu, 15 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 15 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 15 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Microsoft Copilot Flaw Allowed Data Theft via "Reprompt" Session Hijacking Attack
item.description:
Headline: Microsoft Copilot Flaw Allowed Data Theft via "Reprompt" Session Hijacking Attack

Summary:
Researchers discovered a significant vulnerability in Microsoft's Copilot AI assistant that allowed for a "Reprompt" attack, enabling threat actors to bypass safety features, hijack user sessions, and exfiltrate data. The flaw, which has been patched in the January 2026 security update, abused URL parameters to inject hidden, follow-up prompts that executed within the victim's authenticated session. This allowed attackers to chain commands and steal information without the user's knowledge, highlighting the security risks of AI assistants processing untrusted input.

Severity: Medium

Categories: Vulnerability, Cloud Security, Other

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: A 'Reprompt' vulnerability in Microsoft Copilot allowed attackers to hijack user sessions and steal data via malicious URLs. The flaw has been fixed in the January 2026 Patch Tuesday update.

Article Slug: microsoft-copilot-vulnerable-to-reprompt-attack-for-data-theft

Published Date: Thu, 15 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 15 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 15 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: CISA Issues Advisories for Flaws in Rockwell Automation and YoSmart ICS Devices
item.description:
Headline: CISA Issues Advisories for Flaws in Rockwell Automation and YoSmart ICS Devices

Summary:
The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has released several advisories for vulnerabilities in Industrial Control Systems (ICS). The warnings highlight flaws in products from Rockwell Automation and YoSmart used in the critical manufacturing sector. The most severe vulnerability, CVE-2025-9368 (CVSS 7.5), affects Rockwell Automation 432ES-IG3 devices and could allow an attacker to cause a denial-of-service condition requiring a manual reboot. CISA has urged users to review the advisories and apply mitigations, emphasizing network segmentation and secure remote access.

Severity: Medium

Categories: Industrial Control Systems, Vulnerability, Patch Management

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: CISA has issued advisories for vulnerabilities in Rockwell Automation and YoSmart Industrial Control Systems (ICS), including a high-severity DoS flaw (CVE-2025-9368) affecting critical manufacturing.

Article Slug: cisa-warns-of-vulnerabilities-in-rockwell-automation-and-yosmart-ics-products

Published Date: Thu, 15 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 15 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 15 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Pax8 Cloud Marketplace Accidentally Leaks Sensitive Partner and Customer Data
item.description:
Headline: Pax8 Cloud Marketplace Accidentally Leaks Sensitive Partner and Customer Data

Summary:
Cloud commerce marketplace Pax8 has confirmed an accidental data leak after an employee mistakenly emailed a spreadsheet with sensitive business information to a small number of its partners. The file exposed data related to approximately 1,800 Managed Service Provider (MSP) partners, including their customer names, Microsoft licensing details, gross bookings, and NCE renewal dates. While no PII was reportedly included, the exposed commercial data is highly valuable and could be abused by competitors or threat actors to target customers.

Severity: Medium

Categories: Data Breach, Cloud Security

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: Cloud distributor Pax8 confirms an accidental data leak where an employee emailed a spreadsheet exposing sensitive business data of 1,800 MSP partners, including customer and licensing information.

Article Slug: pax8-cloud-marketplace-accidentally-leaks-partner-and-customer-data

Published Date: Thu, 15 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 15 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 15 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: New Zealand's Manage My Health Breach: Timeline Emerges After Hacker Demands Ransom
item.description:
Headline: New Zealand's Manage My Health Breach: Timeline Emerges After Hacker Demands Ransom

Summary:
Details have emerged about the late December 2025 cyberattack on Manage My Health, New Zealand's largest patient portal. A hacker using the alias 'Kazu' claimed to have stolen 108GB of data, including medical records for up to 126,000 users, and demanded a US$60,000 ransom. The New Zealand government has launched a review into the breach, and the company has obtained a court injunction to prevent the publication of the stolen data. The incident has put the cybersecurity of the nation's healthcare sector under intense scrutiny.

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Cyberattack, Regulatory

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: A detailed timeline of the Manage My Health data breach in New Zealand, where a hacker named 'Kazu' stole data from 126,000 patients and demanded a ransom, prompting a government review.

Article Slug: new-zealand-manage-my-health-breach-timeline-and-fallout

Published Date: Thu, 15 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 15 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 15 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Monroe University Data Breach Exposes SSNs and Passport Numbers of Over 320,000 People
item.description:
Headline: Monroe University Data Breach Exposes SSNs and Passport Numbers of Over 320,000 People

Summary:
New York-based Monroe University has reported a data breach that compromised the personal information of 320,973 people. The incident, which took place over a two-week period in December 2024, involved an unauthorized third party accessing and exfiltrating files from the university's computer systems. The compromised data is extensive, potentially including Social Security numbers, driver's license and passport numbers, financial account details, and medical information. The university began notifying affected individuals in January 2026, over a year after the breach occurred.

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Cyberattack, Regulatory

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: Monroe University has disclosed a data breach affecting 320,973 individuals, which exposed highly sensitive data including Social Security numbers, passport numbers, and financial account information.

Article Slug: monroe-university-discloses-data-breach-affecting-over-320000

Published Date: Thu, 15 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 15 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Thu, 15 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: CISA Mandates Patch for Exploited Windows Zero-Day Used in Attack Chains
item.description:
Headline: CISA Mandates Patch for Exploited Windows Zero-Day Used in Attack Chains

Summary:
The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has ordered federal agencies to patch a zero-day vulnerability in the Windows Desktop Window Manager (CVE-2026-20805) by February 3, 2026. The medium-severity information disclosure flaw is being actively exploited in the wild as a crucial component in multi-stage attack chains, allowing attackers to bypass Address Space Layout Randomization (ASLR) and enable more severe exploits like remote code execution. The flaw was addressed in Microsoft's January 2026 Patch Tuesday update.

Severity: High

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Threat Intelligence

Article Type: Advisory

Meta Description: CISA mandates patching for CVE-2026-20805, an actively exploited zero-day information disclosure vulnerability in Windows Desktop Window Manager (DWM) used to bypass ASLR.

Article Slug: cisa-mandates-patch-for-actively-exploited-windows-zero-day-cve-2026-20805

Published Date: Wed, 14 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 14 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Wed, 14 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Ransomware Cripples Belgian Hospital, Critical Patients Transferred
item.description:
Headline: Ransomware Cripples Belgian Hospital, Critical Patients Transferred

Summary:
A major cyberattack, widely reported as ransomware, has crippled the AZ Monica hospital network in Antwerp, Belgium. The incident on January 13, 2026, forced a complete IT shutdown across two campuses to contain the threat. This drastic measure led to the cancellation of at least 70 surgeries and, most critically, required the emergency transfer of seven intensive care patients to other facilities. The attack highlights the severe, life-threatening consequences of cyberattacks on the healthcare sector.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Ransomware, Cyberattack, Industrial Control Systems

Article Type: NewsArticle

Meta Description: A suspected ransomware attack on AZ Monica hospital in Antwerp, Belgium, has forced a complete IT shutdown, cancellation of surgeries, and the emergency transfer of critical care patients.

Article Slug: ransomware-attack-cripples-belgian-hospital-forces-patient-transfers

Published Date: Wed, 14 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 14 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Wed, 14 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Spanish Energy Giant Endesa Hit by Massive Data Breach, 20M Records Allegedly For Sale
item.description:
Headline: Spanish Energy Giant Endesa Hit by Massive Data Breach, 20M Records Allegedly For Sale

Summary:
Spain's largest electric utility, Endesa, has confirmed a data breach after detecting unauthorized access to a commercial platform. The company admitted that customer PII, contact details, and bank account IBANs were potentially exposed. The situation is amplified by a threat actor on a cybercrime forum who claims to have stolen a 1.05 TB database containing the data of over 20 million people, which is now up for sale. Endesa, which serves over 10 million customers, is urging vigilance against phishing and fraud.

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Cyberattack, Industrial Control Systems

Article Type: NewsArticle

Meta Description: Spanish energy utility Endesa confirms a data breach exposing customer PII and IBANs, while a threat actor on a cybercrime forum claims to have stolen a 1.05 TB database affecting 20 million people.

Article Slug: spanish-energy-giant-endesa-suffers-major-data-breach

Published Date: Wed, 14 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 14 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Wed, 14 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Pax8 Data Leak Exposes Sensitive MSP and Customer Info via Accidental Email
item.description:
Headline: Pax8 Data Leak Exposes Sensitive MSP and Customer Info via Accidental Email

Summary:
Cloud commerce marketplace Pax8 has confirmed a data exposure incident caused by human error. On January 13, an employee mistakenly sent an email containing a CSV file with sensitive, non-PII business data for approximately 1,800 Managed Service Provider (MSP) partners. The email, sent to fewer than 40 UK-based partners, exposed valuable information such as customer names, Microsoft license counts, pricing, and contract renewal dates, creating a significant risk of targeted phishing and competitive poaching.

Severity: Medium

Categories: Data Breach, Supply Chain Attack, Cloud Security

Article Type: NewsArticle

Meta Description: Cloud marketplace Pax8 accidentally exposed a spreadsheet containing sensitive business information of 1,800 MSP partners, creating risks of competitive poaching and sophisticated phishing attacks.

Article Slug: pax8-data-leak-exposes-msp-and-customer-data

Published Date: Wed, 14 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 14 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Wed, 14 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: CISA Warns of Critical Flaws in Rockwell & YoSmart ICS Equipment
item.description:
Headline: CISA Warns of Critical Flaws in Rockwell & YoSmart ICS Equipment

Summary:
CISA has released several Industrial Control Systems (ICS) advisories, warning of significant vulnerabilities in widely deployed equipment from Rockwell Automation and YoSmart. A high-severity SQL injection flaw (CVE-2025-12807) in Rockwell's FactoryTalk platform could allow for database takeover, while another flaw (CVE-2025-9368) can cause a denial-of-service condition. Separately, multiple flaws in YoSmart smart home hubs could permit remote device control and data interception, posing risks to both manufacturing and communications sectors.

Severity: High

Categories: Industrial Control Systems, Vulnerability, Patch Management

Article Type: Advisory

Meta Description: CISA issues multiple advisories for critical vulnerabilities in Rockwell Automation and YoSmart industrial control systems (ICS), including SQL injection and denial-of-service flaws.

Article Slug: cisa-warns-of-critical-flaws-in-rockwell-automation-and-yosmart-ics-equipment

Published Date: Wed, 14 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 14 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Wed, 14 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Russian GRU Hackers (APT28) Evolve Credential-Harvesting Tactics
item.description:
Headline: Russian GRU Hackers (APT28) Evolve Credential-Harvesting Tactics

Summary:
The Russian GRU-linked threat group BlueDelta, also known as APT28 or Fancy Bear, has been observed refining its credential-harvesting operations. According to research from Recorded Future, campaigns between February and September 2025 targeted energy, defense, and policy organizations in Europe and Eurasia. The group uses tailored spear-phishing emails, multi-stage redirection, and abuses low-cost, disposable infrastructure like ngrok and other free hosting services to enhance stealth and complicate attribution.

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Phishing, Threat Intelligence

Article Type: Analysis

Meta Description: Russian GRU-linked threat group BlueDelta (APT28/Fancy Bear) is evolving its credential-harvesting tactics, using spear-phishing and disposable infrastructure to target energy, defense, and policy organizations.

Article Slug: gru-linked-hackers-bluedelta-apt28-evolve-credential-harvesting-tactics

Published Date: Wed, 14 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 14 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Wed, 14 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Supply Chain Attack Hits n8n Workflow Automation Platform, Steals OAuth Tokens
item.description:
Headline: Supply Chain Attack Hits n8n Workflow Automation Platform, Steals OAuth Tokens

Summary:
A sophisticated supply chain attack has targeted the n8n workflow automation ecosystem, as reported by researchers at Endor Labs. Attackers published at least eight malicious packages on the npm registry, masquerading as legitimate community-built integrations. These packages were designed to trick developers into entering OAuth credentials, which were then decrypted using n8n's master key and exfiltrated to an attacker-controlled server. This marks the first known supply chain attack specifically targeting the n8n platform.

Severity: High

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Malware, Cloud Security

Article Type: Analysis

Meta Description: A supply chain attack on the n8n workflow automation platform involved malicious npm packages designed to steal OAuth credentials by tricking developers into using fake community integrations.

Article Slug: malicious-npm-packages-target-n8n-workflow-automation-platform

Published Date: Wed, 14 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 14 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Wed, 14 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Russian Hackers Target Ukrainian Military with "PluggyApe" Malware
item.description:
Headline: Russian Hackers Target Ukrainian Military with "PluggyApe" Malware

Summary:
A Russian-linked hacking group, Void Blizzard (also known as UAC-0190), has been targeting the Ukrainian Defense Forces with a new cyber-espionage campaign. According to CERT-UA, the attacks, which occurred between October and December 2025, use a novel malware strain called PluggyApe. The campaign employs sophisticated social engineering, with attackers making direct contact with targets on secure messaging apps like Signal and WhatsApp, using charity-themed lures to build trust and deliver the malware.

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Malware, Cyberattack

Article Type: Analysis

Meta Description: Russian-linked threat group Void Blizzard (UAC-0190) is targeting the Ukrainian Defense Forces with a new malware called PluggyApe, using sophisticated social engineering and charity-themed lures.

Article Slug: kremlin-hackers-target-ukrainian-military-with-pluggyape-malware

Published Date: Wed, 14 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 14 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Wed, 14 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: ConnectPOS Exposed Admin GitHub Token for Over Four Years, Creating Massive Supply Chain Risk
item.description:
Headline: ConnectPOS Exposed Admin GitHub Token for Over Four Years, Creating Massive Supply Chain Risk

Summary:
Point-of-sale vendor ConnectPOS exposed a GitHub Personal Access Token (PAT) with full administrative privileges in its public documentation for over four years, from September 2021 until its discovery in January 2026. The blunder, found by security firm Sansec, put the vendor's entire software supply chain at risk. An attacker could have used the token to inject malicious code, such as a payment card skimmer, into the POS software, which would then be distributed to its 12,000+ customers, including major brands like Asus and Indiana University.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Vulnerability, Data Breach

Article Type: NewsArticle

Meta Description: Point-of-sale vendor ConnectPOS exposed a GitHub Personal Access Token (PAT) with full administrative privileges for over four years, creating a severe supply chain attack risk for its customers.

Article Slug: connectpos-exposed-admin-github-token-for-four-years

Published Date: Wed, 14 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 14 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Wed, 14 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Microsoft's January 2026 Patch Tuesday Fixes 114 Flaws, Including One Exploited Zero-Day
item.description:
Headline: Microsoft's January 2026 Patch Tuesday Fixes 114 Flaws, Including One Exploited Zero-Day

Summary:
Microsoft has released its first Patch Tuesday of 2026, a substantial update that addresses 114 security vulnerabilities across a wide range of its products, including Windows, Office, Azure, and SharePoint. The release includes fixes for eight critical remote code execution (RCE) vulnerabilities and, most notably, one moderate-severity information disclosure zero-day (CVE-2026-20805) that is confirmed to be actively exploited in the wild. This makes it the third-largest January update on record, urging administrators to prioritize deployment.

Severity: High

Categories: Patch Management, Vulnerability

Article Type: Advisory

Meta Description: Microsoft's January 2026 Patch Tuesday security update addresses 114 vulnerabilities, including eight critical RCE flaws and one actively exploited zero-day, CVE-2026-20805.

Article Slug: microsoft-january-2026-patch-tuesday-fixes-114-vulnerabilities

Published Date: Wed, 14 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 14 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Wed, 14 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Ransomware Evolves: Data Theft Now Favored Over Encryption in Extortion-Only Attacks
item.description:
Headline: Ransomware Evolves: Data Theft Now Favored Over Encryption in Extortion-Only Attacks

Summary:
Security analysis reveals a fundamental shift in the ransomware business model, with threat actors increasingly favoring "extortion-only" attacks that forgo data encryption entirely. This evolved tactic focuses on silent, long-term data exfiltration followed by threats to leak the stolen information publicly. This approach is stealthier than traditional encryption and effectively bypasses backup-based recovery strategies, turning every attack into a data breach crisis. Groups like Cl0p and ShinyHunters have pioneered this model, which accounted for a significant portion of the 6,182 extortion incidents in 2025.

Severity: Informational

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Intelligence, Data Breach

Article Type: Analysis

Meta Description: A major trend in ransomware sees attackers shifting to "extortion-only" tactics, prioritizing silent data exfiltration and public leak threats over traditional data encryption.

Article Slug: encryptionless-extortion-becomes-dominant-ransomware-tactic

Published Date: Wed, 14 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 14 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Wed, 14 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: CISA Warns of Actively Exploited RCE Flaw in Gogs Git Service, 700+ Instances Compromised
item.description:
Headline: CISA Warns of Actively Exploited RCE Flaw in Gogs Git Service, 700+ Instances Compromised

Summary:
CISA has added a high-severity path traversal vulnerability (CVE-2025-8110) in the Gogs self-hosted Git service to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog, warning of active exploitation in the wild. The flaw, rated CVSS 8.7, allows an authenticated attacker to achieve remote code execution (RCE). Security firm Wiz reported that over 700 Gogs instances have already been compromised. With no official patch available at the time of the alert, CISA has mandated federal agencies apply mitigations by February 2, 2026.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Supply Chain Attack, Threat Intelligence

Article Type: Advisory

Meta Description: CISA adds CVE-2025-8110, a high-severity path traversal vulnerability in the Gogs Git service, to its KEV catalog due to active exploitation leading to remote code execution.

Article Slug: cisa-warns-of-actively-exploited-rce-flaw-in-gogs-git-service

Published Date: Wed, 14 Jan 2026 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 14 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Wed, 14 Jan 2026 15:00:00 GMT

item.title: UPDATE: Ransomware Evolves: Groups Recruit Insiders, Add DDoS as Profits Fall
item.description:
Headline: Ransomware Evolves: Groups Recruit Insiders, Add DDoS as Profits Fall

Summary:
The ransomware landscape is undergoing a significant evolution heading into 2026. Despite a 47% surge in publicly reported attacks in 2025, analysis from Recorded Future shows that overall profits for threat actors have declined. This financial pressure is forcing a tactical shift. Key trends to watch for include the bundling of DDoS services with ransomware to increase victim coercion, a more aggressive focus on recruiting corporate insiders to gain initial access, and a notable globalization of new ransomware groups emerging outside of the traditional Russian sphere of influence.

Severity: Informational

Categories: Threat Intelligence, Ransomware, Threat Actor

Article Type: Analysis

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: A 2026 cybersecurity trend analysis reveals that ransomware groups are adapting to declining profits by recruiting corporate insiders, adding DDoS attacks to their arsenal, and expanding globally.

Article Slug: ransomware-tactics-evolve-amid-declining-profits-2026
